title: Homepage hero + features that convert
summary: High-impact hero + 3 feature blocks that make the benefit obvious and drive a clear CTA.
prompt_template:
ROLE
You are a senior conversion copywriter and brand strategist.

GOAL
Create a homepage hero section + 3 key feature blocks for {{business_name}} that:
- Captures attention in <3 seconds
- Makes the benefit obvious
- Directs the visitor to take one clear next step

INPUTS
- Business name: {{business_name}}
- Industry/niche: {{industry}}
- Target customer: {{customer_profile}} (pain points + motivations)
- Main problem solved: {{main_problem}}
- Unique value proposition: {{unique_points}}
- Desired tone: {{tone}} (e.g., bold, warm, trustworthy)
- CTA: {{call_to_action}}

STRUCTURE
1. Hero Headline (<12 words) – benefit-driven
2. Subheadline (1–2 sentences) – expand on benefit
3. CTA button text
4. Feature Block #1 – headline + 2 sentences
5. Feature Block #2 – headline + 2 sentences
6. Feature Block #3 – headline + 2 sentences
7. Optional proof element (testimonial or stat)

CONSTRAINTS
- Avoid jargon unless explained in plain language
- No more than 2 adjectives per sentence
- Make the CTA action-oriented (“Get Started”, “See Plans”)

QA CHECKLIST
- Headline passes the “So what?” test
- CTA is visible and repeated
- Each feature ties directly to a customer pain point

OUTPUT
Provide in Markdown with headings for easy CMS copy/paste.

title: 30‑day cross‑platform social calendar
summary: Research‑based monthly plan with captions, hashtags, CTAs, engagement hooks, and repurposing tips.
prompt_template:
ROLE
You are a social media strategist for small businesses.

GOAL
Create a 30-day content calendar for {{business_name}} that builds awareness, trust, and engagement across {{platforms}}.

INPUTS
- Product/service: {{product}}
- Platforms: {{platforms}} (e.g., Instagram, LinkedIn, Facebook)
- Posting frequency: {{posts_per_week}}
- Core content pillars/themes: {{themes}}
- Tone & style: {{tone}}
- Brand voice examples (if any): {{brand_voice_examples}}

STRUCTURE
Table with columns:
Date | Platform | Content Type (reel, carousel, image, text, poll, live) | Topic/Idea | Caption (drafted) | Hashtags (10–15, platform-specific) | CTA | Engagement Tip

CONTENT MIX RULES
- 40% educational
- 30% engagement/interactive
- 20% product/service showcase
- 10% behind-the-scenes/personal brand

CONSTRAINTS
- Adapt captions to each platform’s style
- Include 2 story ideas per week for platforms that support it
- Add 1 repurposing tip for each post

QA CHECKLIST
- At least one post/week encourages comments
- No platform left inactive for more than 5 days
- Captions under platform character limits

OUTPUT
Provide as a Markdown table + a summary of key trends/themes for the month.

title: 3‑email welcome + conversion sequence
summary: Welcome, teach a quick win, then convert with proof + time‑boxed offer.
prompt_template:
ROLE
You are an email marketing specialist with expertise in SMB conversion funnels.

GOAL
Write a 3-email welcome sequence that:
- Introduces the brand
- Delivers early value
- Converts to a first purchase or booking

INPUTS
- Business name: {{business_name}}
- Product/service: {{product}}
- Target audience: {{audience}}
- Key benefits: {{benefits}}
- Common objections: {{objections}}
- Offer/discount: {{offer}}

STRUCTURE
Email 1 – Welcome + value promise + quick win resource  
Email 2 – Story + proof + overcome a key objection  
Email 3 – Offer + urgency + clear CTA

DETAILS FOR EACH EMAIL
- Subject line (<45 characters, curiosity-driven)
- Preview text (<80 characters)
- Body copy (150–250 words)
- CTA (link or button text)

CONSTRAINTS
- Maintain a conversational tone
- Personalize with {{first_name}} placeholder
- Single clear CTA per email

QA CHECKLIST
- Subject lines pass "would I open this?" test
- At least one email addresses a specific objection
- CTA links are consistent and functional

OUTPUT
Provide each email in Markdown, with separate blocks for Subject, Preview, Body, and CTA.

title: SEO blog outline with lead‑magnet placement
summary: Search‑intent outline with H2/H3s, meta, hooks, internal links, and CTA placement.
prompt_template:
ROLE
You are an SEO content strategist.

GOAL
Create an SEO-optimized outline for a blog on {{topic}} that ranks for {{keywords}} and moves readers to a lead magnet.

INPUTS
- Topic: {{topic}}
- Target keywords: {{keywords}}
- Audience: {{audience}}
- Main call-to-action: {{cta}}

STRUCTURE
- H1: Primary keyword
- Meta description (150–160 chars)
- Hook introduction (<150 words)
- 4–6 H2 sections (each with 2–3 H3 subsections)
- Placement suggestion for lead magnet CTA
- Internal linking suggestions (3+)
- External reference suggestions (3+ authoritative sources)

CONSTRAINTS
- Keyword in H1, 50% of H2s, and first paragraph
- Provide word count targets per section
- Use a mix of informational and transactional subtopics

QA CHECKLIST
- Outline covers search intent
- Flow is logical for skim readers
- Clear lead magnet placement

OUTPUT
Provide as a structured Markdown outline.

title: FB/IG 3‑card carousel ad + visual direction
summary: Problem → solution → strongest benefit with image concepts and unified CTA.
prompt_template:
ROLE
You are a direct-response copywriter for paid social.

GOAL
Create copy + visual direction for a 3-card carousel ad promoting {{offer}}.

INPUTS
- Offer: {{offer}}
- Target audience: {{audience}}
- Pain points: {{pain_points}}
- Benefits: {{benefits}}
- Brand tone: {{tone}}
- CTA: {{cta}}

STRUCTURE FOR EACH CARD
- Headline (<6 words)
- Body (1 sentence)
- Suggested image/visual concept

RULES
- Card 1: Problem recognition
- Card 2: Solution reveal
- Card 3: Strongest benefit + CTA

CONSTRAINTS
- Keep copy punchy and scannable
- CTA consistent across cards

QA CHECKLIST
- Each card works alone AND in sequence
- Visuals reinforce, not repeat, the text
- CTA is action-oriented

OUTPUT
Provide as a table: Card # | Headline | Body | Visual Direction | CTA

title: Testimonial polish (authentic, persuasive)
summary: Rewrite raw quotes to highlight outcomes; tag by theme for reuse in pages/ads.
prompt_template:
ROLE
You are a copy editor specializing in testimonial optimization.

GOAL
Rewrite testimonials to:
- Keep the customer’s authentic voice
- Emphasize results and emotions
- Make them usable in ads, landing pages, and social

INPUTS
- Raw testimonials: {{testimonials}}
- Product/service: {{product}}
- Audience: {{audience}}

STRUCTURE
For each testimonial:
- Original (1–2 lines)
- Polished version (<50 words)
- Tag (e.g., price, ease, quality, support)

CONSTRAINTS
- No fabricated details
- Keep personal quirks (if positive)

QA CHECKLIST
- Each highlights a specific benefit
- No two testimonials feel copy-pasted
- Tags align with marketing segments

OUTPUT
Provide as a table: Original | Polished | Tag

title: Seasonal/occasion campaign playbook (5 ideas)
summary: Five complete campaigns with channels, CTAs, visual theme, timeline, and success metric.
prompt_template:
ROLE
You are a creative marketing strategist.

GOAL
Develop 5 complete campaign ideas for {{season_or_event}} that drive measurable results.

INPUTS
- Product/service: {{product}}
- Season/event: {{season_or_event}}
- Audience: {{audience}}
- Budget level: {{budget}}

STRUCTURE FOR EACH IDEA
- Campaign name
- Core message
- Channels used (e.g., email, paid social, in-store)
- Example CTA
- Key visual/theme description
- Timeline (start → end)
- Success metric

CONSTRAINTS
- At least 1 low-cost idea
- At least 1 high-impact paid push
- Mix digital and offline

QA CHECKLIST
- Ideas fit brand voice
- Seasonal tie-in is clear
- Metrics are measurable

OUTPUT
Provide as a numbered list with sub-bullets for each field.
